summary: This is an email chain from December 18, 2020, between U.S. Attorney's Office staff regarding the need to reproduce seven discovery items in the Ghislaine Maxwell case due to incorrect Bates numbering. The paralegal specialist apologizes for the error and outlines the plan to correct and redistribute the documents to defense counsel and to Maxwell at the MDC (Metropolitan Detention Center).

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: She is the subject of the discovery process; documents are being reproduced and sent to her at the MDC.

persons.name: Paralegal Specialist
persons.role: Paralegal Specialist, U.S. Attorney's Office SDNY
persons.context: The sender of the initial email who discovered the Bates numbering error on seven discovery items, takes responsibility, and outlines the plan to correct and redistribute them.

connections.description: The paralegal specialist is part of the prosecution team handling discovery materials that must be provided to the defendant, Maxwell.

events.title: Discovery Reproduction for Maxwell Case
events.description: A paralegal specialist at the U.S. Attorney's Office for the SDNY identifies an error in the Bates numbering on seven discovery items in the Ghislaine Maxwell case and initiates their correction and redistribution.

locations: U.S. Attorney's Office SDNY, 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
MDC (Metropolitan Detention Center, implied location for Ghislaine Maxwell)
keyFacts: On December 18, 2020, a paralegal specialist at the SDNY U.S. Attorney's Office discovered a Bates numbering error on seven discovery items in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.
The error involved missing a digit in the middle of the Bates numbers on documents from the 7th and 8th productions.
The plan was to re-stamp the documents, update a shared discovery index, email them to defense counsel, and burn a CD to send to Ghislaine Maxwell at the MDC.
The document demonstrates procedural aspects of discovery compliance in a high-profile federal prosecution.
